page.topic: How to Customize the Chart Control Background and Labels
page.description: Several pre-configured themes are available for changing how a Chart control looks. Themes are great for many cases, however some effects can only be achieved by using CSS.

discussion.p: The Chart control can be customized by adding classes to style the chart. The Chart Style builder allows you to customize the Chart control's appearance, including several themes and tools for customizing the layout, fonts and colors used in the Chart control.

section.title: Changing the Style of the X-Axis Labels
section.description: The *[ui:Chart Style]* builder can be used to customize the X-Axis and other text in the Chart control.

step.description: Open the *[ui:Chart Style]* builder by clicking the [...] button for the *[ui:Chart style]* property.
Click on the *[ui:Text]* tab to open the *[ui:Text Styles]* editor.
Customize the Font, Color, and Rotation Angle for the *[ui:X-Axis]*.

figure.title: Chart control with an x-axis styled to use 12pt Corbel font that is blue and rotated -45 degrees

section.title: Setting the Chart Background Color
section.description: Some aspects of the Chart control can only be configured using CSS, such as the chart's background color. To set the Chart control's background to a gradient fill, you must write your own CSS:

step.description: Open the *[ui:Chart Style]* builder by clicking the [...] button for the *[ui:Chart style]* property.
Click the *[ui:Edit as CSS...]* link at the bottom of the *[ui:Theme]* tab.
Use the *[ui:[add] Add Selector]* tool on the *[ui:Design]* tab to add the *[chart-client-area]* and create a gradient background fill for the Chart control using the Chart Style Builder.
